pages.title: Smilosuchus
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Triassic$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Lakes, Canyons and Creeks, Flooded$(br2)>Pseudosuchia$(br)>Phytosauria$(br)>Parasuchidae

Smilosuchus was a genus of phytosaur that lived during the Late Triassic in what is now North America. Like other phytosaurs, this massive predator led a semi-aquatic lifestyle very similar to that of a modern crocodile (a classic case of convergent evolution). The jaws of Smilosuchus had two distinct types of teeth: Enlarged tusks at the front of the mouth for impaling prey, and more bladelike teeth further back in the mouth for slicing flesh.
